author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
review: A timeless classic exploring the decadence and disillusionment of the American Dream through the eyes of Jay Gatsby.

author: Harper Lee
review: A poignant portrayal of racial injustice and moral growth in the American South during the 1930s.

author: George Orwell
review: A chilling dystopian novel exploring themes of totalitarianism, surveillance, and the erosion of truth.

author: J.D. Salinger
review: A seminal coming-of-age novel capturing the angst and alienation of adolescence in post-war America.

author: Jane Austen
review: A witty and romantic comedy of manners that explores themes of marriage, class, and societal expectations.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
review: An epic fantasy masterpiece that follows the quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron.

bookName: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
review: The magical journey of a young wizard, Harry Potter, as he discovers his true identity and battles the dark wizard Voldemort.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
review: A charming prelude to The Lord of the Rings, following Bilbo Baggins on an unexpected adventure with dwarves and a dragon.

author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
review: A psychological thriller exploring the moral dilemmas and consequences of a young student's decision to commit murder.
